description:
go.talks/present: switch back to using two part "go build and exec"

Looks like there was a good reason to build and execute the binary
in two steps, instead of using "go run". With "go run", killing the
process would just kill the go tool process, not the child process.

Fixes issue 4266.

messages.text:
Hello r (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.talks

you should put in a comment saying why we don't use go run, since it's not obvious.
also make sure the talk still looks right

Hello r@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

Ping
On 23 Oct 2012 13:02, <adg@golang.org> wrote:

> Hello r@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
>
> Please take another look.
>
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/**6741057/<http://codereview.appspot.com/6741057/>
>

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=1f15ca58c373&repo=talks ***

go.talks/present: switch back to using two part "go build and exec"

Looks like there was a good reason to build and execute the binary
in two steps, instead of using "go run". With "go run", killing the
process would just kill the go tool process, not the child process.

Fixes issue 4266.

R=r
CC=golang-dev
